p: The approx. 1200 amino acid sequence of the spike glycoprotein consists of a large ectodomain, a single pass transmembrane anchor, and a short C-terminal intracellular tail [26], showing several conserved domains and different motifs, namely ( a) a signal peptide (SP) (which commits the protein to the constitutive secretory pathway), ( b) the N-terminal domain (NTD), ( c) the receptor-binding domain (RBD), ( d) the fusion peptide (FP), ( e) the internal fusion peptide (IFP), ( f) the heptad repeat 1/2 (HR1/2), ( g) the transmembrane domain (TM), and ( h) the endo-domain in the cytosol [9], [26] ( Fig. 3B).
